topic.title: Have you tried Aether? A P2P, fully-decentralized, uncensorable reddit clone
topic.body:
I know some of you might have tried Aether in the past, around a year ago; however, there have been major improvements since then, making it noticeably faster and more stable. It's far more active nowadays, as well.

In summary, it is a reddit clone on top of a P2P flood network with ephemeral content (anything older than 6 months is removed).

Link (clearnet): https://getaether.net.

To everyone who wants to try it out: see you there!

1578341356_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: I'd pixelate all thumbnails, to the point where you can make out what's being depicted on the image, but not where you are downloading potentially illegal content. Also being able of blacklisting users or communities is absolutely necessary.
